page.title: 06Housing at Ythanwells
page.content: Most of the houses are about 100 years old. They are built of stone and lime, with slated roofs.Each house has its own water supply, either by gravity or pumped from wells,and an open fire with tiled fireplace and a back boiler for heating water,a bathroom and electricity. Mostly the houses have 2 storeys,the upstairs rooms having sloping ceilings.The estate built most of the farmhouses and owns the land. There are no council houses in the district, but in recent years some of the deserted crofthouses have been bought by newcomers and modernised with the help of a grant from the District Council.
